course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Masterpieces of World Literature
course.description: This course introduces masterpieces of literature from various cultural traditions around the world. Three interrelated archetypes in their thematic manifestations in renowned works from Oriental and Occidental literary traditions, namely, the initiative quest, the femme fatale, and the Pygmalion complex, will be explored in the class.

reviews.author: HaNeiK
reviews.comment_content:
There are few topics, mainly about different masterpieces:
Lu Xun
Gogol
Eagar Allen Poe
Charles Baudelaire
Li Bai, Selected poems & Ezra Pound
Oscar Wilde
Virginia Woolf
Marcel Proust
Liu Yichang

And there's also an Experiential Learning Activity.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good
Professor is passionate in explaining and discussing with the student on the masterpieces and theory.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is good as the professor would like to encourage us, so no low grade is given

Participation
10%
Based on the student’s participation in in-class activities such as discussion.

Group presentation
10%
Students will make a short presentation on assigned literary texts, in which they analyse the work in terms of its structure, style, function and significance.

Experiential Learning Activity
10%
Each group of students will conduct a trip to selected sites of cultural interests and produce a multi-media video clip that features the cross-cultural dialogues in the local cultural space.

Mid-term quiz
30%
Answer 1 question out of 2 about the literary works that aims to encourage students’ imaginative and critical reading.

Final examination
40%
Answer TWO essay questions (20 points for each question) to test students’ knowledge of world literature studies, and their ability to analyse the literary texts.

reviews.author: Varnika
reviews.comment_content: taught about authors from different regions across the world. it included poetry, short stories, movies and a bit of history and context for all the authors. Topics also included things like how translators and their biases affect the consumption of work, portrayal of locations and values according to time period. very enjoyable for those interested in literature.
reviews.comment_teaching: teaching style was interesting. classes were never boring and included many mediums such as movies, presentations, poetry reading. one of the assignments was to travel around Hong Kong and take pictures portraying the story of the city.
reviews.comment_grading: grading was simple and straightforward. the teacher looked into how passionate you were about the topic and rewarded grades accordingly.
reviews.comment_workload: workload was not too much. one group project, two written papers, weekly reading and one final paper. no quizzes but class participation mattered
